column4: at this rate of compilation errors im better off waiting for the package to be released
and the latest sources arent working because of distro's compiler here
I have wine 0.9.38 here - after 'sudo apt-get install wine' - just needs the right repo
atm they only have the sources released for the latest
38 is the best you'll do without building it yourself
or you could just wait a couple days - they usually update pretty quick
because this compiler here isnt working for crap
you cant with this crappy compiler for ubuntu
I believe wine routinely builds with gcc, that's not the issue
